Module kivakit.service.client
Package com.telenav.kivakit.service.registry.client

Class ServiceRegistryClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
      • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
        • com.telenav.kivakit.service.registry.client.ServiceRegistryClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Receiver<Transmittable>, Transmitter<Transmittable>, NamedObject, PackagePathed, Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, Transceiver
    public class ServiceRegistryClient
extends BaseRepeater
    A JSON + REST + JERSEY proxy to ServiceRegistry processes that register services on the local host and discover services by Scope: locally, on remote hosts, in clusters and on the network at large.

    Service registration makes application services discoverable and maps them to physical ports on the local host, ensuring that port conflicts don't occur. These port mappings and other information are automatically propagated to the network-wide registry where it can be queried with this client.

    Note: at this time, only Scope.localhost() and Scope.network() are supported.

    Registry Servers

    ServiceRegistryServer is a command-line application can be run in two modes: as a registry on the local host (on port 23,573) or as a network registry located on a well-known host (on port 23575 by default) that can be specified by the KIVAKIT_NETWORK_SERVICE_REGISTRY_PORT environment variable (the default is kivakit-network-service-registry.mypna.com:23575). When local service registries add, update and expire registration entries, they propagate this information upwards to the network registry, allowing service lookups directed to the network registry to be performed against all services on the network. A web view of current service registrations is available on the ports mentioned above.

    Registry Clients

    Registration and lookup are implemented under-the-hood as JSON REST services and non-Java applications can use this interface directly (see ServiceRegistryRestResource). For KivaKit applications, the ServiceRegistryClient class provides easy-to-use access to the network and local registries. ServiceRegistryClient is simply a Java proxy that implements this ServiceRegistry interface.

    Only ServiceRegistryClient is Public API

    The service registry class has three subclasses: LocalServiceRegistry, NetworkServiceRegistry and ServiceRegistryClient. Only the client (which interacts with the other two subclasses over REST) is intended for use by end-users of the KivaKit.

    Registration

    Services can register themselves by calling register(Service). The application identifier uniquely identifies the registering application on the local host. The Application and Server classes produce such identifiers with the Application.identifier() method. In Application and Server classes, the convenience method register(Scope, ServiceType, ServiceMetadata) can be used. If the KivaKit application framework is not being utilized, any unique string can be used to identify the registrant. The service type specifies an identifier for the kind of service being registered, typically a value supplied as a service interface constant value. When successful, the register() method will return a Service object that is bound to a free port in the ephemeral port range.

    Lookup

    The following methods can be used to look up registered services within a given Scope (local host, network, cluster or on a specific host):

    • discoverApplications(Scope) - A list of applications that have registered service(s) within the given scope
    • discoverPortService(Port) - Find the service running on the given port (and host since Port specifies host)
    • discoverServices(Scope) - All services within the given scope
    • discoverServices(Scope, ServiceType) - All services of the given type within the given scope
    • discoverServices(Scope, ApplicationIdentifier) - All services belonging to the given application within the given scope
    • discoverServices(Scope, ApplicationIdentifier, ServiceType) - A specific application service within the given scope

    Example

    A service can be bound by application A by calling register() on a ServiceRegistryClient: 
         public static final Service.SearchType SERVICE = new Service.SearchType("example-server");
     public static final Identifier APPLICATION_A = new Identifier("application-a");

         [...]

     var service = client.register(APPLICATION_A, SERVICE);
     var port = service.port();

    and application B can do the same thing, registering its own server on a different port: 

         public static final Identifier APPLICATION_B = new Identifier("application-b");

         [...]

     var service = client.register(APPLICATION_B, SERVICE);
     var port = service.port();

    In this way each logical application will be assigned a different physical port for its server.

    A third application, can then look up either application's web server without knowing the port to connect to in advance: 

         var serverA = client.lookup(APPLICATION_A, SERVICE);
     var serverB = client.lookup(APPLICATION_B, SERVICE);

    API Implementation Details

    For details on the implementation service registration, including service expiration and port leases, see LocalServiceRegistry.

    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    LocalServiceRegistry, Service, ServiceType, Scope, ApplicationIdentifier, Port, Result

public @NotNull Result<java.util.Set<ApplicationIdentifier>> discoverApplications​(Scope scope)
        Returns:
        All applications that have registered a service within the given scope

      • discoverPortService

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Result<Service> discoverPortService​(Port port)
        Returns:
        Any service running on the given port. Since a Port includes the host it is unique and only a single service is returned since only one service can be running on a specific port on a specific host.

      • discoverServices

public @NotNull Result<java.util.Set<Service>> discoverServices​(Scope scope,
                                                                ServiceType type)
        Returns:
        All services of the given type that have been registered within the given scope

      • register

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Result<Service> register​(Service service)
        Registers a Service, returning an updated Service object that has been bound to a unique port on the local host and which has a lease on that port for a few minutes. The resulting registration information will be immediately propagated to the NetworkServiceRegistry allowing the given service to be located on the network after calling this method.
        Parameters:
        service - The service to register
        Returns:
        The registered service, bound to a port

      • register

        public Result<Service> register​(Scope scope,
                                ServiceType serviceType,
                                ServiceMetadata metadata)
        Convenience method that registers a service of the given type using the current KivaKit Application or Server to fill in the service version and to create an application identifier and service description. If this method is called from an application that is not using the kivakit-core-application base classes, a best effort is made to fill in service registration details.
        Parameters:
        scope - The scope within which the service should be visible
        serviceType - A unique identifier for the type of service used in search/discovery
        metadata - Metadata for the service. If a description is not provided, one will be generated. The KivaKit version and service version will be automatically filled in from the Application or Server that is using this client.
        Returns:
        The registered service, or null if it was not possible to do so due to network or server error.

      • sendNetworkRegistryUpdate

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Result<java.lang.Boolean> sendNetworkRegistryUpdate​(Service service)
        Not public API

        Updates the given service in a network-wide registry of KivaKit services. Local service registries running on individual hosts push service registration information to the network service registry via this method when initial service registration and lease renewals occur. Services are transparently looked up in the network service registry client when a network Scope is searched.

        Returns:
        True if the service was added

      • version

        public Version version()
        Returns:
        The version of this service registry client
